com.viaoa.comm.multiplexer.io

Class MultiplexerServerSocketController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.comm.multiplexer.io.MultiplexerServerSocketController

  • public class MultiplexerServerSocketController
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages multiplexed server socket connections. This will use a "real" ServerSocket to accept new "real" client socket connections. The real connections are then managed by a MultiplexerSocketController so that new sockets can be multiplexed inside the "real" socket.
    Author:
    vvia
    See Also:
    com.ice.comm.server.MultiplexerServer#

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiplexerServerSocketController()
      Created by MultiplexerServer to manage a "real" serversocket, to accept client connections created by MultiplexerClient.

        MultiplexerOutputStreamController#

      • getThrottleLimit

        public int getThrottleLimit()

      • onAcceptRealClientConnection

        protected void onAcceptRealClientConnection(java.net.Socket socket)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        This is internally called when a new "real" client socket connection is accepted on the server. This will create a MultiplexerSocketController (ISC) to manage the connection. The ISC will then create MultiplexerSockets, which will then be "given" to MultiplexerServerSocket accept(). This method is thread safe, since only one accept() can be done at a time.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • timeoutConnections

        protected void timeoutConnections()
        Used by Thread to check new connections to make sure that they are valid connections. Each new connection is given 5 seconds to be validated by MultiplexerSocketController.

      • add

        protected void add(MultiplexerSocketController vsc)
        Adds a new SocketController to list.

      • remove

        protected void remove(MultiplexerSocketController vsc)
        Removes a SocketController from list.

      • getSocketControllers

        protected MultiplexerSocketController[] getSocketControllers()
        Returns:
        list of all client connections.

      • getServerSocket

        public VirtualServerSocket getServerSocket(java.lang.String serverSocketName)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new ServerSocket that will accept new client MultiplexerSockets through a multiplexed connection. This is used by MultiplexerServer to create new server sockets.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        com.MultiplexerServer.comm.server.MultiplexerServer#createServerSocket(String, com.VirtualSocket.comm.socket.MultiplexerSocket.Type)
